title: U.S. students who have used hallucinogenic drugs 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, Hispanic had the highest Share of students in Sex Male and Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students in Sex Female.
In Sex Male, White (non-Hispanic) had the maximum Share of students and it saw the lowest in Sex Female out of all 3 Sexs.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 15.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for White (non-Hispanic).
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
Out of all 4 groups, Hispanic had the highest Share of students in Sex Male and Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students in Sex Female.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 4 groups, Hispanic had the highest Share of students in Sex Male and Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students in Sex Female.
In Sex Male, White (non-Hispanic) had the maximum Share of students and it saw the lowest in Sex Female out of all 3 Sexs.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 15.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for White (non-Hispanic).
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
Sex Male had the maximum Share of students among all 4 groups, and it was for Hispanic. The minimum Share of students was observed in Sex Female for Black (non-Hispanic).
Among all the Sexs, White (non-Hispanic) had the highest Share of students in Sex Male and lowest Share of students in Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 15.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for White (non-Hispanic).
Among all 4 groups, Black (non-Hispanic) had the gap of 34.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of students observed in Sex Male and Female respectively.

In Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0. The second highest Share of students 76.0 was observed for Hispanic in Sex Male.

On average, the Sex Male had the highest Share of students for all 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. Whereas Female had the lowest average Share of students.
